inclusion.criterion: met by emergency services within 4 hours after symptom onset
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: sudden weakness of leg or arm, especially on one side, facial asymmetry and/or sudden trouble walking, and speech disturbance
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients from the Hospital dispatch center area, being more than 10-15 minutes drive from the hospital
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: giving informed consent, written or oral, if possible or consent from relative at site
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: female < 50 years and uncertainty of pregnancy
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: 62-year-old African-American man with left upper and lower extremity weakness, dark visual spot in right eye, facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech. Medical history significant for hypertension, hyperlipidemia and hypothyroidism.
